author: Ezra Pound
title: In a Station of the Metro
lines: The apparition of these faces in the crowd:
Petals on a wet, black bough.

author: Matsuo Bashō
title: The Old Pond
lines: A frog jumps into the pond—

author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson
title: The Eagle
lines: He clasps the crag with crooked hands;
Close to the sun in lonely lands,
Ring'd with the azure world, he stands.
The wrinkled sea beneath him crawls;
He watches from his mountain walls,
And like a thunderbolt he falls.

author: Amir Khusrau
title: He Visits My Town Once a Year
lines: He visits my town once a year.
He fills my mouth with kisses and nectar.
I spend all my money on him.
